item.title: About
item.description: This site will host the blogposts associated with the Bio-group Development Series sessions. The site theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.

item.title: Data Download and Sanitation (and our first plot!)
item.description: Libraries At the top of any script we write, first we include all the libraries used in this analysis. These “libraries” are packages of code that we import to our script so we may use some of their handy features. For example, the “xml2” library allows us to download a webpage and extract all of the text from it in just a few simple lines of code! A few commonly used libraries include data.

item.title: Welcome to the Bio-Group Development Series
item.description: March 30, 2020 Hello, and welcome to a summary the first training session for bio-group technical development! This is an Rmarkdown document that will walk you through what we did in the first session on March 30, 2020. With the myriad statistics of the novel coronavirus pervading most media outlets, we opted to examine the data ourselves to obtain a clearer understanding of the spread of the disease. We opted to use the dataset maintained bythe Johns Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering (JHU CSSE), for two main reasons:
